title: Infuriated internet users share the most pointless packaging
text:
Shoppers are becoming more aware of plastic waste - but that hasn't stopped retailers from using excessive packaging for their goods.

Photographs taken by people from across the world show the instances where they've faced wasteful wrapping.

Compiled by Bored Panda, the images include individually wrapped apples to triple boxed allergy medication.

Here, FEMAIL selects some of the worst examples...

These retailers have been accused of using excessive amounts of packaging for their products. Here, a giant cardboard box was sent containing two small batteries to an unknown location

This tiny non-drowsy pill to help combat allergies was sold inside a sachet and then placed in a large plastic package at one unidentified gas station

One supermarket, believed to be in the UK, wrapped an apple in a polystyrene box that was wrapped in plastic

This photograph reveals how much pointless packaging was used to send just two small batteries to an undisclosed location

An anonymous woman shared this image showcasing a tiny powdered concealer from Sephora, a French beauty brand, which apparently was delivered in this huge box

One unidentified man found it amusing to hide in the paper he'd been sent after finding it wrapped around some eco-friendly light bulbs

This customer was astonished when opening their candle to find this much bubble wrap around the product. It is unclear where the image was taken

When finally unwrapped, it was quickly revealed that these toys arrived in a mountain of packaging. It is believed the image was taken in America

This tiny SIM card was sent in a giant cardboard box to the disbelief of the outraged shopper, whose location wasn't known

This cat litter arrived at an undisclosed location in a huge cardboard box with loads of packaging - despite not being at risk of breakages

A Dell order of six ink cartridges had each one sent in a separate box. The cardboard holders were four times the size of the products. It is unclear where the picture was taken

Each of these plastic straws were individually wrapped and then placed in a large plastic packet to the annoyance of the unknown customer
description: Photographs taken by people from across the world show the instances where they've faced wasteful wrapping. The images were compiled in an online gallery by Bored Panda.
